column4: Probably this is stupidly simple, but how can I uninstall apache2 ?
sudo apt-get remove apache2
Package apache2 is not installed, so not removed. Maybe I installed it from source, not using apt-get?
This is possible. Or you may have installed apache1 mistakenly
sudo apt-get remove apache
according to top, I'm running apache2 (6 processes at 111m a shot) I don't remember how I installed it now though
Hmm. Did you have to do something like download, then ./configure then make or make install?
If I downloaded it, I probably have it saved on here still, let me look
If so, need to find the directory you did that in and do:  make uninstall           or: make clean
I wouldn't have guessed that, thanks, I'm grateful for the help
np.. it is not an obvious thing
It is best when possible to install a package instead of from source
strange, I don't have it in my user directory, it must have been installed another way, I wouldn't have deleted that
I tried sudo aptitude remove apache2 as well, no luck
does it come standard with ubuntu gutsy?
(server version)
Well, a down-and-dirty way is to:    sudo apt-get install --reinstall apache2; sudo apt-get remove apache2      (with --purge optionally)
It will force an install from package over the compiled version, then remove it
I'm willing to try that at this point
Work needs me, expect lag for next bit
Did that last try take?
